com.apstrata.client.android
Class Client

java.lang.Object
  com.apstrata.client.android.Client

public class Client
extends java.lang.Object

Responsible for making calls to the backend apstrata service and returning the response as text (json or xml) or as an inputstream. In order to build request urls for successful backend validation, this class delegates the signature of requests to an implementation of the Connection interface. Such implementations currently include the AnonymousConnection, the OwnerConnection, the UserConnection and the TokenConnection. The connection implementation is plugged into the client object at instantiation time and may be replaced at runtime as needed. A typical usage is the following: 

 Connection connOwner = new OwnerConnection("someBaseUrl", "someKey", "someSecret");
 Client apsClient = new Client("someBaseUrl", "someKey", connOwner);
 String resp = apsClient.callAPIJson("SaveDocument", parameters, files, mode);
 // convert the text response into a json object etc...

              java.lang.String accKey,

Parameters:
baseUrl - identifies the scheme and the apstrata server that is targeted. Ex: "https://sandbox.apstrata.com/"
accKey - identifies the customer account
conn - identifies the connection object responsible for signing requests

getSignedRequestUrl

public java.lang.String getSignedRequestUrl(java.lang.String methodName,
                                            java.util.List<org.apache.http.NameValuePair> parameters,
                                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.io.File>> files,
                                            Client.AuthMode mode)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
Returns a string representing the full URL with the additional necessary query string including the request signature

Parameters:
methodName - identifies the API method being invoked
params - is a list of NameValuePair objects representing the HTTP text parameters to be sent to the server along with the request
files - is a map representing file parameters to be sent to the server along with the request. An entry's key is the parameter name, and the value is a list of files representing the [multiple] value[s] for this parameter
mode: - identifies the signature type: Simple or complex
Returns:
String: A request Url duly signed by the current connection
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

mode: - identifies the signature type: Simple or complex
Returns:
the String response as received from the apstrata sevice

callAPIStream

public java.io.InputStream callAPIStream(java.lang.String methodName,
                                         java.util.List<org.apache.http.NameValuePair> params,
                                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.io.File>> files,
                                         Client.AuthMode mode,
                                         org.apache.http.client.HttpClient httpClient)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
invokes an apstrata api by specifying the api name, parameters and an HttpClient object. the calling code is responsible for closing the httpClient upon consuming the stream. This method is used typically to request apstrata file attachments

Parameters:
methodName - identifies the API method being invoked
params - is a list of NameValuePair objects representing the HTTP text parameters to be sent to the server along with the request
files - is a map representing file parameters to be sent to the server along with the request. An entry's key is the parameter name, and the value is a list of files representing the [multiple] value[s] for this parameter
mode - is the signature type: simple or complex
httpClient - is the HttpClient used by the client object. the calling code is expected to close this httpClient (as needed) upon consuming the stream
Returns:
an input stream that returns the data sent by apstrata in response to the call
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

callAPIJson

public java.lang.String callAPIJson(java.lang.String methodName,
                                    java.util.List<org.apache.http.NameValuePair> params,
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.io.File>> files,
                                    Client.AuthMode mode)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
invokes an apstrata api by specifying the api name, parameters and requesting the JSON return format. this would be the same as calling #callAPI(String, List, Map) after setting the parameter RESPONSE_TYPE_PARAM with the single value RESPONSE_TYPE_JSON

Parameters:
methodName - identifies the API method being invoked
params - is a list of NameValuePair objects representing the HTTP text parameters to be sent to the server along with the request
files - is a map representing file parameters to be sent to the server along with the request. An entry's key is the parameter name, and the value is a list of files representing the [multiple] value[s] for this parameter
mode: - identifies the signature type: Simple or complex
Returns:
the String response in JSON format as received from the apstrata sevice
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

mode: - identifies the signature type: Simple or complex
Returns:
the String response in XML format as received from the apstrata sevice

callAPIFile

public java.io.File callAPIFile(java.lang.String methodName,
                                java.util.List<org.apache.http.NameValuePair> params,
                                Client.AuthMode mode,
                                java.lang.String path)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
invokes an apstrata file-returning api by specifying the api name, parameters and the path to the destination file. This method is used typically to request apstrata file attachments

Parameters:
methodName - identifies the API method being invoked
params - is a list of NameValuePair objects representing the HTTP text parameters to be sent to the server along with the request
mode: - identifies the signature type: Simple or complex
path - is the path to the destination file, where the content of the file attachment is to be stored
Returns:
a handle to the destination file, where the content is stored
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
